intro: Iris albispiritus, commonly known as the white spiraled iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers with a distinctive white spiral pattern on the petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with sword-shaped leaves that are dark green and glossy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
